epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives, placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note_on_impact_categories: Some impact categories modelled separately based on generic processes for indicators not included in existing EPDs.

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good across all states
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

end_of_life.control: Holcim has no control over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

embodied_carbon_reduction_targets.by_2050: Net zero for all new construction materials

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete (carbonation) during use stage is recognized but not included in this EPD
carbon_emission_context.carbon_footprint_reporting_standard: Aligned with IPCC 2013 Fifth Assessment Report (AR5) excluding biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

Abiotic depletion potential (elements and fossil fuels)

Total use of renewable primary energy
additional_environmental_impact_indicato: Global warming potential excluding biogenic uptake
